Great Value! Recommended Day Tour from Lima

Jan 2025 â€¢ Family
This tour is an absolute must! You start early in the morning from Lima and head to Ballestas Islands, followed by pisco and wine tasting, and end at the Huacachina Oasis for dune buggy rides and sandboarding.

At Ballestas Islands, you take a couple-hour boat tour where you can spot whales, the Nazca Lines, sea lions, and penguins. The nearby town is charming, and you can walk around to buy souvenirs.

Next, you head to Ica to enjoy a beautiful sunset while trying a variety of pisco and wines. Lunch is also included here.

Finally, you visit the incredible Huacachina Oasis, surrounded by endless desert dunes. You get to ride dune buggies for an exhilarating experience and try sandboardingâ€”itâ€™s unforgettable!

This tour is absolutely worth it! We chose to stay overnight and arranged a private car to return to Lima the next day, but most people head back the same day. Highly recommend it!

For the adrenaline seekers

Ok. First of all, a DISCLAIMER: if you have fear of roller-coasters, speed or heights: avoid. 54am wake up call for a 17 hr day. Good punctual staff
Saul was our guide and he made a chat room to keep us to date on the trip. They puck you up at the hotel and drive you to breakfast. Great bread!!! Wao. Then... drive to Panacas for a ferry ride with a spanish speaking guide. You see many species of birds, sea lions, pups and even starfish. Sunny weather with a cool breeze. Bring sun block and a scarf. The ride is quite chilly. Then drive to lunch. EXCELENT food at "El Catador". 4 choices of entries and 8 of main cource. NO WIFi... then hace 5 shots of wine, pisco, and borgoÃ±a. Washrooms facilities are available for 1 sol. Then 20 minutes to Huicachina. Small yown with plenty of shops and sellers. Up a hill in a dun on foot to the ATVs. Get reasy for adrenalin, sand, up and downs in the biggest dunes I have ever seen. Some of the passangers got sick... threw up... and got super dizzy. 15minutes out: do sand surfing and take pictures. Temperature was 30 celcious and with a fresh breeze. Got sand IN my socks and tennis shoes. Still I had a great time. 4 hrs drive back to Lima.
Written November 28, 2021
